value.title: LEVEL UP Power BI Conditional Drill with Paginated reports!
value.excerpt: Take Power BI Conditional Drill to the next level by incorporating Paginated reports with your strategy! Patrick shows a customer scenario that he solved using this approach.  Paginated reports doc: https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/paginated-reports/paginated-reports-report-builder-power-bi  Power

value.title: Looking into the future of Power BI (2021)
value.excerpt: The new release wave was published for Power BI! This is the roadmap for what is to come. Adam explores what it shows and what you can expect. value.title: Mark as Date Table in Power BI Desktop is here!
value.excerpt: Mark as Date Table in Power BI Desktop is finally here! In this video, Patrick takes what Adam did with a custom date table and shows you how you can use Mark as Date Table in Power BI Desktop. This feature was introduced in the February 2018 release of Power BI Desktop. Mark as Date Table has been available

value.title: Mashup Engine Query Monitor for Power BI Refresh
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick introduces the Mashup Engine Query Monitor for Power BI Refresh. This is the MEQM! A report that can be useful to see SQL Server queries that Power BI issues during refresh.  MEQM Files - https://github.com/guyinacube/demo-files/tree/master/video%20demos/MEQM  LET'S CONNECT!  Guy

value.title: My CHECKLIST for troubleshooting Power BI Performance
value.excerpt: We OPTIMIZE PERFORMANCE on a lot of models for Power BI. And, over the years, we start with the same first few things. Adam walks you through his steps.  Performance Analyzer: https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/create-reports/desktop-performance-analyzer  DAX Studio: https://daxstudio.org/  Tabular

value.title: 'OraOLEDB.Oracle' provider is not registered
value.excerpt: Highlights an issue that could occur when creating a Data Source within Power BI Admin Center. value.title: Paginated URL Parameters
value.excerpt: Adam shows you how Power BI Paginated URL Parameters can help to export data beyond 150,000 rows in Power BI reports.  Documentation: https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/report-builder-url-parameters  Download example: https://guyinacu.be/paginatedexportsample  Guy in a Cube courses: https://guyinacu.be/courses

value.title: Power BI and Microsoft Flow - Monitoring your data
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick shows how you can use Microsoft Flow, combined with Power BI, to monitor data and alert you when something is available.  This takes advantage of a streaming dataset and using the schedule recurrence in Microsoft Flow to trigger an action as Patrick wasn't using anything else to
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/B4dCLtQ53pA" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Power BI Auditing
value.excerpt: In this video, I look at the Power BI Auditing feature that was made available a few weeks ago. I show how to turn it on and how to search. This can be helpful with understanding who is doing what within your organization.  Offical Docs: https://powerbi.microsoft.com/en-us/documentation/powerbi-admin-auditing/
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/zj4kA39jV_4" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Power BI: Case of the unexplained date (LastDate in DAX)
value.excerpt: Adam looks at why the LastDate DAX function is returning the wrong date within Power BI Desktop. Breaking down a twitter conversation.  Download files used in video: https://guyinacu.be/unexplaineddatesample   Twitter thread: https://twitter.com/dhawalmehta/status/1183750809646972929  Marco's Blog: https://www.sqlbi.com/articles/semi-additive-measures-in-dax/

value.title: Power BI dataflows: One thing you probably missed with your gateway
value.excerpt: Adam looks at how you can get your gateway working with Power BI dataflows, even if you aren't an admin of the gateway. There is one thing that most people overlook. We show you what it is!  Guy in a Cube courses: https://guyinacu.be/courses  ******** LET'S CONNECT! ********  -- http://twitter.com/guyinacube

value.title: Power BI Desktop - Sync Slicers with KillaDBA
value.excerpt: In this video, Homer McEwan (aka KillaDBA), joins Patrick to learn the clicks for sync slicers in Power BI Desktop. Patrick also shows the new group functionality in the May 2018 release of Power BI Desktop.  KillaDBA - Migration Plan song - https://youtu.be/c2R7oMW2u0w   LET'S CONNECT!  KillaDBA - Twitter:

value.title: Power BI For Report Consumers
value.excerpt: In this video, we look at Power BI for report consumers. Those folks that maybe don't author reports, but just view reports within Power BI. We introduce some basic Power BI concepts and introduce you to areas of the Power BI service to get you familiar with the portal.  LET'S CONNECT!  Guy in a Cube
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/FMcnf5WU0x8" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Power BI License Assignment
value.excerpt: You have different options for Power BI license assignment. I look at what those are. From the Office 365 Admin portal to PowerShell. I also do a quick recap of the different licenses available.  For an example of how to assign licenses via PowerShell you can look at the following. It isn't specific

value.title: Power BI Paginated Reports: Visualizing Data
value.excerpt: Paginated reports in Power BI are now available. Now that you have data, Patrick walks you through how to build a matrix visual within the report. He also looks at how to work with expressions and formatting.  LET'S CONNECT!  Guy in a Cube -- https://guyinacube.com -- http://twitter.com/guyinacube --

images.title: Power BI Paginated Reports: Visualizing Data

value.title: Power BI parameters - Updating in the Power BI Service or with APIs
value.excerpt: In this video, Adam looks at how you can update Power BI parameters within the service or by using APIs. You can create Power BI Parameters within Power BI Desktop using Power Query. Then you can update those Power BI parameters once the report is published to the Power BI service.  PowerShell Samples:
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/MJVSu47iMmo" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Power BI Publish to Web can be SCARY!?!
value.excerpt: Some don't realize that Power BI Publish to Web is not secure. Adam shows you that this is the case. It's a bit scary and there are other options to have secure embedding.  Two Alex's Video - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=S3tWcCcZilw  Patrick's SharePoint video - https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Kevw0PFnFD8
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/gJFKFnOd-hU" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

value.title: Power BI User lookup with the gateway using Active Directory
value.excerpt: In this video, Adam looks at how you can use Active Directory custom attributes for the user lookup with the Power BI Gateway. This can be used for both Analysis Services mapping and the Kerberos SSO with DirectQuery connections.  Manage your data source - Analysis Services https://docs.microsoft.com/power-bi/service-gateway-enterprise-manage-ssas#usernames-with-analysis-services
value.featuredContent: <iframe width="800" height="500" frameborder="0" src="https://www.youtube.com/embed/NG05PG9aiRw" allow="accelerometer; autoplay; encrypted-media; gyroscope; picture-in-picture" allowfullscreen></iframe>

images.title: Power BI User lookup with the gateway using Active Directory

value.title: Report level measures with Power BI live connections
value.excerpt: In this video, Patrick looks at how you can create report level measures, within Power BI Desktop, against SQL Server Analysis Services Tabular live connections, or against a Power BI service dataset live connection. He also explains what is meant by report level measures. Bust out your DAX toolbelt

value.title: Row-Level Security in Power BI - Revisited
value.excerpt: We had some recent changes to Row-level security in Power BI. Row-level security (RLS) was moved to be configured in Power BI Desktop with the June 2016 release.  I walk through how you could can configure this now in Power BI Desktop. I also talk about some of the limitations.  LET'S CONNECT!  Guy in

value.title: Setting default values using COALESCE in DAX
value.excerpt: Learn how to get default values using the DAX COALESCE function instead of IF statements. A great way to avoid BLANK in Power BI! value.title: STOP refreshing a single table at a time! (Power BI Desktop)
value.excerpt: Stop refreshing one table at a time! Also, don't wait for the entire data model to finish refreshing. Refresh multiple tables within Power BI Desktop. value.title: Using different languages with the Power BI site
value.excerpt: I look at how your browser languages affect what is displayed. This all comes down to your browsers and the language settings within. Different browsers are configured differently. Fiddler can show you what your language order is.  SUBSCRIBE! https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCFp1vaKzpfvoGai0vE5VJ0w?sub_confirmation=1

value.title: Using Power BI reports from an end user perspective (2021)
